com.ufabc.mcta025.zkprimitives

Class ZKBarrier

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ufabc.mcta025.zkprimitives.ZKPrimitive
      • com.ufabc.mcta025.zkprimitives.ZKBarrier

  • public class ZKBarrier
extends ZKPrimitive
    A barrier is a primitive that enables a group of processes to synchronize the beginning and the end of a computation. The general idea of this implementation is to have a barrier node that serves the purpose of being a parent for individual process nodes. See Barrier and Queue Tutorial.

      • ZKBarrier

        public ZKBarrier(org.apache.zookeeper.ZooKeeper zk,
                 java.lang.String root,
                 int size,
                 java.lang.Integer mutex)
        The ZKBarrier class represents the Barrier primitive.
        Parameters:
        zk - the active ZooKeeper instance
        root - the path to store the Barrier children
        size - the size of the Barrier
        mutex - the mutex object to be synchronized
